column3: str
I'm quite busy at the moment, so unless you have something to ask...
What will you ask?
What do you do here?
What is a weaver?
Nothing.
I am Redolent Rose, and I oversee all Weavers' Guild operations. I also instruct members on the finer points of our trade─something I am quite good at, mind you.
My most skilled protégés go on to create magnificent garments which are coveted the realm over.
Indeed, it would be no exaggeration to say that the designs born here shape Eorzean fashion.
It matters not how great or small the commission─we never fail to deliver the highest quality to the customer.
Simply put, a weaver transforms thread into cloth and cloth into clothing.
More specifically, weavers craft light, flowing garments such as robes and coatees─the kind favored by mages and craftsmen.
While a novice weaver should focus on producing serviceable wares, we expect our more experienced members to blend form with function.
But regardless of one's experience, a weaver must ever strive to hone his craft if he wishes to achieve <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> maintain success.
Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. We meet again.
Ah, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Mistress<Else/>Master</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,2)/>. We meet again.
...Mayhap you wonder why I do not call for the Brass Blades? Please. Your virtue is more intact than that of a maiden at the altar. So─what brings you here today?
What will you ask?
How are things between Wawarukka and Kokomo?
What is a weaver?
Nothing.
Their courtship continues, but I cannot say how long it will last. They were not particularly well acquainted prior to our intervention, in case you have forgotten.
I do not mean to diminish our accomplishment, but the first expression of affection is but a single step in a never-ending journey.
As they learn more of one another, they may grow closer together or further apart. Which is fine. They will be richer for the experience, regardless of the outcome.
If you so dearly wish to play the part of a neophyte, I suppose I can indulge you this once. Do not make it a habit.
Simply put, a weaver transforms thread into cloth and cloth into clothing.
More specifically, weavers craft light, flowing garments such as robes and coatees─the kind favored by mages and craftsmen.
While a novice weaver should focus on producing serviceable wares, we expect our more experienced members to blend form with function.

But regardless of one's experience, a weaver must ever strive to hone his craft if he wishes to achieve <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> maintain success.
...Thus ends our charade.
